original_title: Sri Lankan Engineering begins to maintain Cebu Pacific aircraft
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lankan Airlines said its engineering unit has conducted ‘heavy maintenance’ work on a Cebu Pacific Airbus A330 (Trent 700) aircraft, becoming the first South East Asian Airline client.

“The heavy maintenance check on the Cebu Pacific Air aircraft was performed in Sri Lankan Engineering’s dedicated European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) approved wide-body hangar over a period of four days,” Sri Lankan Airlines said in a statement.

“It was also the third heavy maintenance by Sri Lankan Engineering for a customer airline during a busy May, with the other checks being carried out on two Airbus A330 (CF6) aircraft of Serene Air, who came aboard last year.”

It was also the third heavy maintenance by Sri Lankan Engineering for a customer airline during a busy May, with the other checks being carried out on two Airbus A330 (CF6) aircraft of Serene Air, who came aboard last year, Airlines said.

Sri Lankan said the increasing demand for its MRO services has also resulted in an increasing dollar revenue for Sri Lankan Engineering, which saw a 35 per cent jump in earnings between the last two financial years. (Colombo/ June 20/2023)
